conclusion: Use ideal gas law PV = nRT to find temperature at state C
State A: Pressure P1, Volume V1, Temperature T0
At state A, P1 V1 = nRT0 using ideal gas law
State B: Pressure P2, Volume V1
At state B, P2 V1 = nRTB using ideal gas law
State C: Pressure P2, Volume V2
At state C, P2 V2 = nRTC using ideal gas law
State D: Pressure P1, Volume V2
Process from C to D is isochoric and from D to A is isobaric
Express nR from state A as nR = P1 V1 / T0
Substitute nR into equation for TC: TC = P2 V2 / (P1 V1 / T0)
Simplify to get TC = P2 V2 T0 / P1 V1
Final answer: Temperature at state C is TC = P2 V2 T0 / P1 V1
